page.title: 07Trethosa C.P.School
page.content: The village of Treviscoe is served by the primary school which is situated on the road to St.Stephen. There are 37 children in the school and two full-time teachers. Children are aged between five and eleven. The building is old - it was built in 1900 for a cost of Â£1500. The toilets are outside at the bottom of the playground.There is a field with soccer posts and although there are no trees at present many trees and shrubs are to be planted during the coming winter. It is also planned to improve and extend the school garden. School starts at 9.00a.m. and finishes at 3.00p.m. Lunch break is from 12.00 till 1.00. The school meals (65p)are cooked at St.Dennis Junior School. Quite a lot of children bring a packed lunch. This year the school obtained a computer- just in time to compile this survey!
